topic.title: Amazon Web Services
topic.shortdesc: You can deploy Couchbase Server to Amazon Web Services (AWS).

section.title: Accessing Amazon Web Services
section.p: To access Amazon Web Services (AWS) you need an AWS account. For information on how to do so, see the AWS documentation for Creating an AWS Account.

section.title: Preparing for Deployment on AWS
section.p: Before deploying Couchbase Server-instances, you must prepare your AWS environment. Proceed as follows:

ol.li: Access the AWS Console, here, and sign in.
When the console appears, select the EC2 option, near the upper-left of the main panel:
When the Resources page for your account appears, left-click on the Launch Instance button, in the Create Instance section, in the middle of the screen:
When the Choose an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) page appears, select Red Hat Enterprise Linux:

When the Choose an Instance Type page appears, select m4.large:
Then, left-click on Review and Launch:
The Review Instance Launch page should now appear, confirming that your instance has been launched.

Left-click on the Launch button, at the lower-right:
The Select an existing key pair or create a new key pair dialog now appears:
You must use this to specify or create a pair keys (one public, for AWS; the other private, for yourself), which you will use to access AWS security.

li.p: If you have already created a key pair, for AWS-access, use the dialog-interface to specify that pair. If you have not done so, use the interface as follows.
From the upper field, select Create a new key pair. The lower field is now an interactive text-field, which can take input from your keyboard and mouse.
In the lower field specify a name for your key pair. Note that this must be unique across AWS.

Next, left-click on the Download Key Pair button, at the lower-right. The key pair is now downloaded, as a .pem file. You will reference this file when accessing AWS from the console, on your local machine.
Finally, left-click on the Launch Instances button at the lower-right. Your instance is now launched. The Launch Status page appears, providing a reference to your launched instance:
Left-click on this reference. Your console now appears, featuring details of the running instance:
